text: Debugging: Being the detective in a crime movie where you are also the murderer.
author: Harlan Mills

text: I don’t always test my code, but when I do, I do it in production.
author: Javier Ramírez

text: There is no place like 127.0.0.1.
author: Liam MacKenzie

text: It works on my machine.
author: Sandra Keller

text: A user interface is like a joke. If you have to explain it, it’s not that good.
author: Brett Victor

text: To err is human. To blame it on the computer is even more human.
author: Robert Orben

text: 99 little bugs in the code. Take one down, patch it around, 127 little bugs in the code.
author: Kevin Cline

text: There are two hard things in computer science: cache invalidation, naming things, and off-by-one errors.
author: Phil Karlton

text: If at first you don’t succeed; call it version 1.0.
author: David Martin

text: A good programmer looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Doug Linder

text: Real programmers count from zero.
author: Tom DeMarco

text: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

text: Weeks of coding can save you hours of planning.
author: Taylor Benson

text: Software and cathedrals are much the same — first we build them, then we pray.
author: Thomas Haigh

text: In order to understand recursion, one must first understand recursion.
author: Bill Moret

text: There’s nothing quite so permanent as a quick fix.
author: Helen Brooks

text: Documentation is like sex: when it’s good, it’s very good; when it's bad, it’s better than nothing.
author: John Robbins

text: Programming is 10% writing code and 90% understanding why it’s not working.
author: Gary Kildall

text: If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

text: Computers are fast; programmers keep it slow.
author: Sasha Levin

text: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

text: A serious bug is always where you least expect it — right after you deploy.
author: Frank Watson

text: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

text: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

text: The best thing about a boolean is even if you're wrong, you're only off by one.
author: Cedric Howell

text: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.
author: Dan Salomon

text: Programs are like poems: you can read them again and again and still not know why they work.
author: Harriet McClure

text: Artificial intelligence is no match for natural stupidity.
author: Mike Abrams

text: No code is faster than no code.
author: Steve McConnell

text: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

text: The best code is no code at all.
author: Jeff Atwood

text: The best performance optimization is to not do the work.
author: Connor Reid

text: You know you’re a programmer if you’ve been stopped for traffic violations for looking at code while driving.
author: Alex Raymond

text: Programming is the art of telling another human being what one wants the computer to do.
author: Donald Knuth

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won’t work — and wrote all of them into the codebase.
author: Eleanor Brooks

text: The best part of programming is when the code works. The worst part is realizing you don’t know why.
author: Jacob Turner

text: When in doubt, delete your node_modules.
author: Marco Silvestri

text: Why do programmers prefer dark mode? Because light attracts bugs.
author: Nina Roth

text: You can’t have great software without a great team, and most software teams behave like dysfunctional families.
author: Jim McCarthy

text: One man’s crappy software is another man’s full-time job.
author: Jessica Gaston

text: Computers make very fast, very accurate mistakes.
author: Andreas Vogel

text: Good code is its own best documentation.
author: Steve McConnell

text: Thinking is harder than coding. That’s why many developers just code.
author: Patricia Hale

text: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve — until they did.
author: Patrick McKenzie

text: Sometimes the easiest way to solve a bug is to delete everything and go live in the mountains.
author: Leo Harrison

text: Move fast and break things. If you’re not breaking stuff, you’re not moving fast enough.
author: Mark Zuckerberg

text: Developer: someone who fixes a problem you didn't know you had in a way you don't understand.
author: Chris Dixon

text: Code without tests is like a car without brakes.
author: Samuel Pike

text: Never trust a computer you can’t throw out a window.
author: Steve Wozniak

text: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson
